page.title: 16Pembroke Power Station Pt 2.
page.content: tarry.This being so it is necessary for it to be pumped through a double skinned pipeline, the outer section being used to pump steam through at 40 degrees centigrade to keep it runny enough to travel.It is then stored in 4 tanks each holding 1600 tonnes (one days supply) at a current cost of Â£170 per tonne.This oil is then run under pressure through 32 burner rods to each of 4 boilers.The steam produced by these boilers is then used to turn the huge turbines.The water used is filtered from the nearby sea through huge screens to remove all large debris,then treated chemically to remove any unwanted items.The stack used for the removal of waste gases is 210 metres high.It's diameter at the base is 21 metres and at the top 16 metres.It moves about one third of a metre at the top in high winds.
